import React from 'react'; import Navbar from './Navbar'; import preambleImage from '../Images/Preamble.png'; import '../App.css'; function Preamble() { return ( <>

Understanding the Preamble

The Preamble to the Constitution of India is a brief introductory statement that sets out the guiding purpose, principles, and philosophy of the document. It reflects the hopes and aspirations of the people of India.

Key Terms Explained:

  • Sovereign: Independent authority of India to govern itself.
  • Socialist: Social and economic equality among all citizens.
  • Secular: Equal treatment of all religions by the state.
  • Democratic: Government elected by the people.
  • Republic: Head of state is elected, not a monarch.
  • Justice: Social, economic, and political fairness.
  • Liberty: Freedom of thought, expression, belief, faith, and worship.
  • Equality: Equal status and opportunities for all citizens.
  • Fraternity: Brotherhood and unity among all Indians.
); } export default Preamble;
